page.title: 04CLUBS
page.content:
Boys of ages 8-11 years have Cubs and from 11 years onwards go to Scouts. Girls of 7-10 years can join Brownies, after which they attend Guides. These organisations encourage the children to take an interest in a variety of activities, and they are awarded badges for completing various tasks. Children can also join Climbers, Explorers and Pathfinders which are Church run organisations.
For people aged over 60 years there is the Silver Thread Club where they can meet, go on outings or play organised games like cards or Bingo. For the ladies there is the Womens Institute, an organisation for any age group, which organises a variety of meetings. Sports Clubs include Cricket,Bowls, Football, Keep Fit and Judo.
